title: Logout any user of same team

activities.message:
**New Attack scenario & its critical**
A user (Attacker) can restrict all the other users of  same team to access their account i.e. they will never be able to remain looged in. Whenever a user will login then after login users will be suddenly automatically logged out of their account.

Victims will not have to visit any other malicious website containg the above html code because attacker can use https://teamname.slack.com/files/create/post to embed the above url which is being used to logout users.

**Steps to Verify:**
1. Login to your slack team and navigate to https://teamname.slack.com/files/create/post.
2. Give any title to the post.
3. Input ![image title](https://teamname.slack.com/reset/youareloggedout) and save & publish the post.
4. Now login from another account and click on the post above created. Opening this post will log you out of your account.

Now whenever you login to that account after loged in you will be imediately logged out of your account as the malicious post will be remain open in the Flexpane and will trigger the logout. And actually now you will never be able to login to that account.

I thinks now its not only a simple Logout issue but now its becomes more severe as attacker can restrict all the other users of same team to able to login to their account for forever.

And kindly fix this soon because now I am not able to login to my own account.

Thanks
**Uttam Soren**
activities.markdown_message:
New Attack scenario & its critical
A user (Attacker) can restrict all the other users of same team to access their account i.e. they will never be able to remain looged in. Whenever a user will login then after login users will be suddenly automatically logged out of their account.

Victims will not have to visit any other malicious website containg the above html code because attacker can use https://teamname.slack.com/files/create/post to embed the above url which is being used to logout users.

Steps to Verify:

  1. Login to your slack team and navigate to https://teamname.slack.com/files/create/post.
  2. Give any title to the post.
  3. Input ![image title](https://teamname.slack.com/reset/youareloggedout) and save & publish the post.
  4. Now login from another account and click on the post above created. Opening this post will log you out of your account.

Now whenever you login to that account after loged in you will be imediately logged out of your account as the malicious post will be remain open in the Flexpane and will trigger the logout. And actually now you will never be able to login to that account.

I thinks now its not only a simple Logout issue but now its becomes more severe as attacker can restrict all the other users of same team to able to login to their account for forever.

And kindly fix this soon because now I am not able to login to my own account.

Thanks
Uttam Soren

activities.message: Thanks for the detailed report - a fix for this issue has now been released.
activities.markdown_message: Thanks for the detailed report - a fix for this issue has now been released.

vulnerability_information_html:
It is possible for a user to logout other member of same team even if they had selected Keep me signed in option.

Steps to Verify:

  1. Login to your team i.e https://yourteamname.slack.com.
  2. On new tab on the same browser request a url which would be like https://yourteamname.slack.reset/youareloggedout
  3. You will be automatically logged out of your account even if you have selected Keep me signed in option.

Attacker can embed the invalid password reset link in a image tag in a website of his/her control and when users visists the page they will be logged out.

<html>
<head>
<title>I Logged You Out</title>
</head>
<body>
<img src='https://yourteamname.slack.com/reset/youareloggedout'>
</body>
</html>

You should not logout a user when an invalid password reset link is accessed rather than you should redirect a user to homepage whenever a password reset link is accessed when user is allready logged in.

Thanks
Uttam Soren
vulnerability_information: It is possible for a user to logout other member of same team even if they had selected *Keep me signed in* option. **Steps to Verify:** 1. Login to your team i.e [https://yourteamname.slack.com](https://yourteamname.slack.com). 2. On new tab on the same browser request a url which would be like [https://yourteamname.slack.reset/youareloggedout](https://yourteamname.slack.reset/youareloggedout) 3. You will be automatically logged out of your account even if you have selected **Keep me signed in** option. Attacker can embed the invalid password reset link in a image tag in a website of his/her control and when users visists the page they will be logged out. ` I Logged You Out ` You should not logout a user when an invalid password reset link is accessed rather than you should redirect a user to homepage whenever a password reset link is accessed when user is allready logged in. Thanks **Uttam Soren**
